name: Critical Unarmed Miss
description:
Fighters that cannot fall down: Treat any "fall down" result as [[1d3]] points of general injury.

Flyers and swimmers: Treat any "fall down" result as being forced into an awkward position with the same effective results (-4 to attack, -3 to defend).

results.text: You knock yourself unconscious! Roll vs. HT every 30 minutes to awaken.

If attacking or parrying with a limb, take 1 HP of injury and the limb is temporarily "crippled" -- you cannot use it for 30 minutes.

Otherwise, pull a muscle and suffer Moderate Pain (p. 428): -2 to all DX, IQ, skill, and self-control rolls for the next 20 - HT minutes (minimum of 1).

You hit a solid object and take crushing damage equal to your THR to the body part you used (DR protects nomrally).

Exception: If attacking a target with a ready impaling weapon, you fall on their weapon. Take the weapon's damage, but based on your ST.

You hit a solid object and take crushing damage equal to half your THR to the body part you used (DR protects nomrally).

Exception: If attacking a target with a ready impaling weapon, you fall on their weapon. Take half the weapon's damage, but based on your ST.

If attacking with natural weapons such as claws or teeth, they break: -1 to their damage until healed.

* Attacking
You stumble and advance 1 hex past your target, facing away: they are now behind you!

* Parrying
You fall down. While Prone, you are at -3 to all defenses, -4 to all melee attacks, and can only move 1 hex per turn. It takes two turns to go from Prone, to Kneeling, to Standing.
You fall down. While Prone, you are at -3 to all defenses, -4 to all melee attacks, and can only move 1 hex per turn. It takes two turns to go from Prone, to Kneeling, to Standing.
You lose your balance and can do nothing else until your next turn (not even free actions). All Active Defenses are at -2 until then.
You trip. Make a DX roll to avoid falling down (at -4 if kicking, or at twice the usual DX penalty for any technique that requires a DX roll to avoid mishap even on normal failure).
You drop your guard. All your active defenses are at -2 for the next turn, and any Evaluate bonus or Feint penalty against you until your next turn counts double. This is obvious to others.

* Attacking
You stumble and advance 1 hex past your target, facing away: they are now behind you!

* Parrying
You fall down. While Prone, you are at -3 to all defenses, -4 to all melee attacks, and can only move 1 hex per turn. It takes two turns to go from Prone, to Kneeling, to Standing.

You tear a muscle. Take [[1d3]] points of injury to the limb you used (to one limb, if you used two), or to your Neck if biting, butting, etc.

You are off-balance and at -1 to all attacks and defenses for the next turn. You are at -3 to any action involving that limb (or to any action, if you injure your Neck) until this damage heals. Reduce this penalty to -1 if you have High Pain Threshold.

You hit a solid object and take crushing damage equal to your THR to the body part you used (DR protects nomrally).

Exception: If attacking a target with a ready impaling weapon, you fall on their weapon. Take the weapon's damage, but based on your ST.

If attacking or parrying with a limb, take 1 HP of injury and the limb is temporarily "crippled" -- you cannot use it for 30 minutes.

Otherwise, pull a muscle and suffer Moderate Pain (p. 428): -2 to all DX, IQ, skill, and self-control rolls for the next 20 - HT minutes (minimum of 1).
You knock yourself unconscious! Roll vs. HT every 30 minutes to awaken.
